intro: Utricularia nana, commonly known as the small bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, floating leaves and specialized bladder-like structures used for capturing prey. This plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and marshes. Utricularia nana is a carnivorous plant that uses its bladders to trap small aquatic organisms. Its delicate appearance and unique feeding mechanism make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
